organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Aerosol in a Dental Clinic
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of Aerosol in a Dental Clinic

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of external evacuation units and mouth rinses during aerosol generating procedures in a dental clinic and to determine the risk level to the dental practitioners during aerosol generating procedures.

armGroups.label: High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and hydrogen peroxide
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and Placebo
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and Placebo

interventions.name: High volume evacuation (HVE)
interventions.description: Intra oral suction will be done and during the procedure,bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab. Patient will be given a mouth rinse.
armGroupLabels: HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and Placebo
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and Placebo
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and hydrogen peroxide

interventions.name: Extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA)
interventions.description: Extraoral suction connected to dental suction will be used and bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab. Patient will be given mouth rinse.
armGroupLabels: HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and Placebo
HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide

interventions.name: Hydrogen Peroxide
interventions.description: Subjects will be given 1.5 % Oral Solution of hydrogen peroxide mouth rinse
armGroupLabels: HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and hydrogen peroxide
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and hydrogen peroxide

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Subjects will be given a placebo (plain water) mouth rinse
armGroupLabels: HVE suction and extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA) and Placebo
High volume evacuation (HVE) suction only and Placebo

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Bacterial Colony Forming Units (CFUs)
primaryOutcomes.description: At baseline (1 hour before treatment), four agar petri dishes will be placed at standardized distances (2 ft, 3 ft, 4 ft, and 6 ft) from the dental chair headrest in the operating room. An impinger will also be positioned 2 ft from the headrest. The number of bacterial colony-forming units (CFUs) will be counted for each petri dish and the impinger after a 72-hour incubation period. The average number of Bacterial CFUs is reported.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Bacterial Colony Forming Units (CFUs)
primaryOutcomes.description: At the start of treatment, four agar petri dishes will be placed at standardized distances (2 ft, 3 ft, 4 ft, and 6 ft) from the dental chair headrest in the operating room for one hour. An impinger will also be positioned 2 ft from the headrest for one hour. The number of bacterial colony-forming units (CFUs) will be counted for each petri dish and the impinger after a 72-hour incubation period. The average number of Bacterial CFUs is reported.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 hour from the start of the treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Bacterial Colony Forming Units (CFUs) at Each Location
secondaryOutcomes.description: At baseline (1 hour before treatment), four agar petri dishes will be placed at standardized distances (2 ft, 3 ft, 4 ft, and 6 ft) from the dental chair headrest in the operating room. An impinger will also be positioned 2 ft from the headrest. The number of bacterial colony-forming units (CFUs) will be counted for each petri dish and the impinger after a 72-hour incubation period. The number of Bacterial CFUs per location is reported

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Bacterial Colony Forming Units (CFUs) at Each Location
secondaryOutcomes.description: At the start of treatment, four agar petri dishes will be placed at standardized distances (2 ft, 3 ft, 4 ft, and 6 ft) from the dental chair headrest in the operating room for one hour. An impinger will also be positioned 2 ft from the headrest for one hour. The number of bacterial colony-forming units (CFUs) will be counted for each petri dish and the impinger after a 72-hour incubation period. The number of Bacterial CFUs per location is reported.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 hour from the start of the treatment

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* prepping natural teeth at the appointment
* at least an hour long procedure
* procedure will be the first one in the morning

overallOfficials.name: Claudia Ruiz Brisuela, DDS
overallOfficials.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

locations.facility: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

groups.title: High Volume Evacuation (HVE) Suction Only and Hydrogen Peroxide
groups.description:
High volume evacuation (HVE): Intra oral suction will be done and during the procedure,bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab. Patient will be given a mouth rinse.

Hydrogen Peroxide: Subjects will be given 1.5 % Oral Solution of hydrogen peroxide mouth rinse

groups.title: HVE Suction and Extraoral Vacuum Aspirator (EVA) and Hydrogen Peroxide
groups.description:
High volume evacuation (HVE): Intra oral suction will be done and during the procedure,bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab. Patient will be given a mouth rinse.

Extraoral vacuum aspirator (EVA): Extraoral suction connected to dental suction will be used and bacterial colony forming units (cfus) will be captured during dental care by placing large format petri dishes containing bacterial culture media in the dental operatory with open lids. Once aerosol capture is complete, petri dishes will be incubated and quantified under BSL-2 safety conditions in the lab. Patient will be given mouth rinse.

Hydrogen Peroxide: Subjects will be given 1.5 % Oral Solution of hydrogen peroxide mouth rinse

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Bacterial Colony Forming Units (CFUs)
outcomeMeasures.description: At baseline (1 hour before treatment), four agar petri dishes will be placed at standardized distances (2 ft, 3 ft, 4 ft, and 6 ft) from the dental chair headrest in the operating room. An impinger will also be positioned 2 ft from the headrest. The number of bacterial colony-forming units (CFUs) will be counted for each petri dish and the impinger after a 72-hour incubation period. The average number of Bacterial CFUs is reported.
